catalog_info.title: Is Knowledge Power?
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: The aphorism “knowledge is power” evokes menacing images, such as state surveillance or corporate ownership of personal information, and hopeful images, such as curing disease or controlling personal destiny.  We hear contradictory messages that the internet and other new information tools are either freeing us or enslaving us.  What then is the relation between knowledge and power? This course will examine this question through close study of three historical cases, each rich with source material and analytic accounts.  In the final section of the course, students will select and analyze current issues that raise unresolved problems of knowledge and power.
